meanings.definition: Unpleasant or distasteful in flavor or smell.
meanings.sent1: The food looked yucky and made me feel sick.
meanings.sent2: I don't like the taste of yucky vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The yucky smell coming from the garbage can was unbearable.
meanings.sent4: The pond water was so yucky, it seemed like it was alive.
meanings.sent5: The yucky odor in the room lingered long after the garbage was taken out.

meanings.definition: Disgusting or revolting in appearance or texture.
meanings.sent1: The slimy and yucky texture of the food made me gag.
meanings.sent2: The bathroom was so yucky that I didn't want to go in.
meanings.sent3: The yucky mess on the floor looked like a science experiment gone wrong.
meanings.sent4: The yucky feeling of mud squishing between my toes was oddly satisfying.
meanings.sent5: The yucky sight of the moldy bread made me lose my appetite.
